NATO allies yield to Trump's demands, pledging 3.5% of GDPs to military spending
subhead: At the summit in The Hague, the US achieved what it had come for: a commitment by Europeans and Canadians to increase their military spending. While Donald Trump did not challenge the allied solidarity of Article 5, he secured a minimalist final declaration.
byline: By Philippe Jacqué (The Hague, Netherlands, special correspondent) and Elise Vincent (The Hague, Netherlands, special correspondent)

Le Pen, Bardella and the slow poison of competition
subhead: Relations between Marine Le Pen and Jordan Bardella, leaders of the far-right Rassemblement National party, have grown strained since May, as speculation that Bardella might run for president in 2027 gains traction.

title: Japan is questioning its alliance with Donald Trump's United States
subhead: Faced with Trump's unpredictable policies, Japanese leaders are considering the need to develop an alternative diplomatic and security strategy to reduce their dependence on the US.

title: China has enlisted star influencers to boost its global image
subhead: Taiwanese and US influencers share their China trips on social media, seemingly wowed by everything. A state-run media outlet even offers all-expenses-paid trips to influencers with more than 300,000 followers.

title: 'Dating apps have every interest to turn our love lives into gruyère cheese, full of holes and short-lived misfires'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Arnaud Poissonnier, author of a book examining the love industry, advocates for regulating the sector through a professional association and calls on platforms to 'completely rethink their systems.'

Robert Malley: 'The adversaries of the Islamic Republic of Iran would be wrong to celebrate too much'
subhead: Israel's recent military offensives in Gaza, the West Bank, Lebanon and, together with the US, in Iran, will fuel hatred of the West and a desire for revenge across the Middle East, writes Robert Malley, the lead negotiator of the 2015 Iranian nuclear deal.

title: French MPs investigating TikTok: 'Young people are being sacrificed'
subhead: A parliamentary committee investigating TikTok's psychological effects on minors, launched in March under rapporteur Laure Miller and chair Arthur Delaporte, who spoke to Le Monde, wrapped up its hearings on June 24.

title: New museum will honor Art Nouveau genius Hector Guimard in Paris
subhead: The museum devoted to the architect who designed the Paris metro entrances will be housed in the Hôtel Mezzara, one of his masterpieces. It is expected to open at the end of 2027 or the beginning of 2028.
